Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Yesterday we had watched Mussolini Son of the Century in which there are a few characters had been shown to be with Mussolini or at least in his Blackshirt & Fascist movement. But who are they specifically? At some point some of us may not noticed, but they do have some screentime for a few moments which signifies how important they are.

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content:
Albino Volpi
- Just as Mussolini suggested in first episode, he had a criminal record before joining the military, mostly common criminal records
- He was a part of the Ardinti, then joined Piave Caimans, a marine infantry of Italy.
- Yes, he did throw a grenade irl as we seen in episode 1 during its end, in which it caused eleven injuries but no death in 1921.
- He was known to be very violent, taking part on a lot of raids against Socialist, later on assassinating socialist figures multiple times in the name of Mussolini
- Mussolini was known to called him "the apple of my eye."
- He would later become the "de facto" boss of Verziere, a mafia of sort before his death as he was granted immunity by Mussolini and his Milanese fascist groups.

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: He died at the age of 50

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: His irl photo

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content:
Amerigo Dumini
- He is what had been described in the series: an American born Italian
- After he had done with the Great War, in 1919, he was beaten by left wing activists when he tried to return into the hospital. This was originally what caused him join the fascist groups of Italy.
- His first kill includes Renato Lazzeri & Lazzeri's mother in 1921. He also forced a republican parliamentaria Ulderico Mazzolani drinking castor oil while kidnapping him.
- Later on, he will be known as the Italian hitman of the fascist groups, collaborating in murdering figures that were against fascism.
- In the future, he will do his career as a blackmailer, even go as far as blackmailing Mussolini and his scandals to get compensation.
- He would be known to be thrown and released into prisons for like 5 to 7 times from Interwar to Post-WW2.
- He even wrote a book that was released in 1950 and 1956, telling his stories as a squad member. During that time he had joined the Italian Social Movement in 1956, an heir to the fascist movement of Mussolini.

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: he died at 73 years old

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: His irl photo

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content:
Cesare Rossi
- Just like Mussolini, he used to collaborate with other Socialist groups, even the Internazionale.
- He may looked like the side character in the series, but originally he was the founder of Fascio Rivoluzione d'Azione Internazionalesta in Italy by 1914 along with Mussolini.
- He joined Freemasonry once, only to resigned in 1923.
- He became the national vice-secretary of the Fasci in 1920 before got promoted to secretary of the Fasci in 1921.
- He would later produce several memoirs while in prison for Matteotti crime, known as the Rossi Memorial. Later on after he was released but got arrested Post-WW2 in which he was arrested this time, by the allies. 
- He would be released 4 years and 2 months after being pardoned by the sovereign, returning to journalism until his death in 1967.

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: he died at 80 years old

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: His irl photo

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content:
Aldo Finzi:
- Just in the series showcase during flight, he was Mussolini's pilot.
- He participated as a foot soldier, artillery office and as a pilot during Great War
- Just as Mussolini claimed, he was a soldier of valor with him receiving both silver and two bronze medals of military valor for his contribution during the Great War.
- He was born as a Jewish-Italian, which later caused him to be resistance against the Italian Racial Laws of 1938 which advocated for the discrimination of Jewish descent people.
- Later on he would become the resistance fighters against the Germans in WW2 in which he formed the resistance forces, sabotaging the Axis after he was released in 1943, being sentenced in prison due to him claiming the Allies would win while fascist regime shall fall. This gave him a turn of event from a pro-fascist to now pro-allied force.
- Unfortunately, he would be dead through massacres by the Germans in Ardeatine Caves massacre on 24 March 1944, killing him along with more than 300+ Italian prisoners, including Jews, political prisoners, etc

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: he died at 50 years old, declared as the Italian Holocaust Hero
